intro: Schunda-pana, commonly known as the mountain morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of Nepal and India. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas at high altitudes. Its flowers are usually blue or purple and bloom in the early morning. Schunda-pana is valued for its ornamental beauty and has traditional uses in local medicine.
